title: Minimum Height Trees
description: A tree is a connected, acyclic graph. A minimum height tree (MHT) is a tree that has the smallest height among all trees that can be formed with a given set of edges. Given a number of nodes n and a list of edges, your task is to find all the possible roots of minimum height trees. If there are multiple roots, return them all in ascending order.
input_format: An integer n representing the number of nodes (1 <= n <= 2 * 10^4) and a list of edges where each edge is a list of two integers [u, v].
output_format: A list of integers representing the roots of the minimum height trees, sorted in ascending order.

examples.explanation: Node 1 is the root of the minimum height tree as it connects to all other nodes directly.
Nodes 3 and 4 are roots of minimum height trees because they provide the shortest path to all other nodes.

hints: Try to reduce the graph by removing leaves iteratively.
The remaining nodes should be the potential roots for the MHT.
Observe how the degree of nodes changes as you remove leaves.
